We know that the cosets $Hg$ form a partition of $G$ (see the coset
entry for proof of this.) Since $G$ is finite, we know it can be
completely decomposed into a finite number of cosets. Call this number
$n$. We denote the $i$th coset by $Ha_i$ and write $G$ as

$$G = Ha_1 \cup Ha_2 \cup \cdots \cup Ha_n$$

since each coset has $|H|$ elements, we have

$$|G| = |H|\cdot n$$

and so $|H|$ divides $|G|$, which proves Lagrange’s theorem. $\square$
